intro: Verbascum gaetulum, commonly known as the Gaetulan mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are broad and velvety, often used traditionally for their medicinal properties. Verbascum gaetulum is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant.
